intro: Pterolepis alpestris var. latifolia, commonly known as the alpine broad-leaved pterolepis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. This variant is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
